Hosting and Updating

Hosting

Extensions must be uploaded through the Developer Dashboard and are distributed in the Chrome Web Store to protect users from malicious extensions. Enable inline installation to allow users to add an extension from the web store without leaving the website.

There are two exceptions to the Chrome Web Store hosting rule:

  1. Extensions that comply with the enterprise policy.
  2. Unpacked files from your local machine while in developer mode.

Read more about the hosting policy.

Updating

Extensions are automatically updated without user intervention, just like the Chrome Browser.

To update an extension, you will need to increase the version number in the manifest and re-package it. Locate the extension in Developer Dashboard and click Edit. After you have uploaded the new version and clicked Publish the update will automatically be pushed out to users over the next few hours.
